## Government Tender Announcement

### Regulatory Takeoff and Landing Weight Analysis Services
---

The Department of National Defence is soliciting bids for Regulatory Takeoff and Landing Weight Analysis Services. The solicitation is governed by the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP) and the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA).

### Tender Description

The Department of National Defence requires a supplier to provide on-demand Regulatory Takeoff and Landing Weight Analysis (RTOWL) services. The services must meet the requirements outlined in the Airbus A310 Flight Crew Operating Manual.

The supplier will be responsible for providing the following services:

* Takeoff weight analysis on an ad-hoc basis as requested by the Department of National Defence
* Airport Physical Characteristics Revisions
* Maintenance of a master PDF file database for RTOW data
* Emergency 24-hour response when required for last-minute operational requests

Each RTOWL chart must contain the following minimum features:

* Maximum Takeoff Weight for the runway
* Takeoff distance available
* V Speeds (V1/Vr/V2) given different headwind, tailwind, and calm winds conditions
* Special Single Engine Departure Procedures to ensure obstacle clearance
* Maximum Single Engine Go Around configurations

### Evaluation and Selection

The evaluation will be based on the mandatory technical evaluation criteria outlined in Annex "D" of the solicitation. Suppliers must comply with the requirements of the bid solicitation and meet all mandatory technical evaluation criteria to be declared responsive.

The responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for award of a contract.

### Contract Period

It is anticipated that any contract will be effective for three (3) years from the date of contract award, with an option to extend the term by up to two (2) additional one-year periods.
